definition: to guide a horse with the reins/to rein in a horse
to strap tightly/to bind
to rein in/to compel/to force/to carve/to engrave/(literary) to command/to lead/bridle/(physics) abbr. for 勒克斯[le4 ke4 si1], lux
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
lit. to rein in the horse at the edge of the precipice (idiom)/fig. to act in the nick of time

sentences.english: The impression of the splendour of Tianya, reality into the brink.
sentences.chinese: 印象中的蝶舞天涯，现实中成了悬崖勒马。

sentences.english: We need consumers who will hold their feet to the fire.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要悬崖勒马的用户。

sentences.english: Rapidly, Zhou Yu managed to rein back, but he was shot in the left rib and fell to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 周瑜急勒马回时，被一弩箭，正射中左肋，翻身落马。

sentences.english: Stopped the horse, Pingzhi Lin jumped down and walked in the eatery.
sentences.chinese: 一勒马，飘身跃下马背，缓步走向酒肆。

sentences.english: In gratitude, he soon afterwards bought a piece of property at Burgh-le-Marsh.
sentences.chinese: 出于感激，不久他就在伯勒马什买了一块地产。

definition: to urge on a horse using a whip or spurs
horse's head/same as 碼頭|码头[ma3 tou2], pier
to turn/to turn around/to transfer (funds etc)
to come to a stand/to stop
to dismount from a horse/(fig.) to abandon (a project)
to whip on/to raise a whip/by ext. to swagger
to speed along
reins
horseback
Malaya/Malaysia
bridle/reins/halter
variant of 韁|缰[jiang1]
to shout an order or command
to gallop/to spur on a horse/to let one's steed have his head
cavalry/caravan of horses carrying goods
horsewhip
to shout
